reviews.review_msg: I had Ryan as a TA for both crim 300w and crim 317. He comes across as a little intimidating at first, but is actually really hilarious and caring. I felt that he had high expectations, but went out of his way to provide tons of feedback on assignments. He also tries to make course content applicable to real life settings. Would highly recommend!

Very straightforward lectures that provide clear expectations for what she's looking for in the assignments. Since this was a W class there was an outline, bibliography and term paper to submit which were all very doable and she offered examples to follow. No complaints whatsoever, and TA Kelley was great, accessible for help and gave good feedback

The course was self-directed with a few quizzes, assignments, and a term paper. The assignment outlines were unclear, lectures & slides were unorganized, and going to campus for tutorial or lecture were not a good use of time. The course did not teach me anything new or important. Regardless, Dr. Spicer is understanding and nice.
Dr Spicer is fantastic!!!!!! Helpful, kind, passionate, and is clear in regards to what she expects from her students. Not too easy, not too hard. Highly recommend!
Very nice prof that really cares about her students.
Really good instructor! I enjoyed this class thoroughly. He is very passionate about criminology and always made an 8.30 class interesting! Fair expectations, fair marking, easy-going!

need the textbook, entire class is based on empirical evidence and theories.  This prof loves to see empirical evidence in exams and essays. he marks hard. writing intensive. he likes to see main concepts from theories combined with your critical thinking with empirical evidence to support or refute arguments made.

Honestly I was scared looking at the reviews but class was not bad. Had Janine as my TA, absolute best. She always clarified and provided amazing feedback. Prof's lectures were interesting/informational. End of term test was kind of surprising and difficult - the theories tested were not common theories. Midterm paper 8-10 pages + final paper 12-15
great class if you like crying during a final
u could do good in the whole class and here comes the final to knock u down
Brutal final
you guys…what was that final exam…i'm so mind bLOWN at how atrocious it is omg… we better be CURVED

didn't go to a single lecture, put in minimal effort and got a B+. Very easy class, just grind out a couple papers on the day its due and u can forget about this class for the rest of the semester. other than tutorial participation which was whatever

Dr. Lysova's class was a breath of fresh air. I found applying theories to real-life scenarios incredibly engaging. Dr. Lysova's encouragement of critical thinking and objectivity made her an exceptional instructor.

Dr. Lysova's course completely changed my perspective. Applying theories to everyday situations felt so natural by the end. I'm grateful for Dr. Lysova's emphasis on critical thinking; it was truly valuable. Her teaching style, which was both objective and creative, made her stand out as an excellent professor.

Nice prof but there are major areas where she can improve:

1. Communicate with TAs better because it leads to miscommunication and it was present during the course.

2. A final exam where we're given 2 hours to write 3 essays (6 pages each) being graded on grammar, isn't too realistic.

3. Be present since during the final exam, she wasn't there.
The best professor at SFU. Dr. Lysova is highly educated, knowledgeable, passionate, and kind. Also, she did her best to support us during the strike.

I enjoyed this class. Although lectures were not mandatory, they were informative and helped understand difficult concepts. Case studies and examples were interesting and helpful. Tutorial participation mattered.

Lectures were pretty useless for this course since the two papers you have to write were just based on the textbook, however, attendance for tutorials was mandatory since it's worth a significant portion of your grade. Overall, the course itself was not difficult but the papers did feel repetitive as they were pretty much about the same topic.

No exams which made lectures very optional (went to first 2 and that was it). You have to write 2 papers and submit outlines a couple weeks before the real thing is due. They're long ones (10-15 pages each) but the topics are relatively easy to write a lot about. Tutorial participation is worth like 25% so its important u show up and participate.

You really don't need to go to the boring lectures because assignments can be done with the readings only. Assignments are not too hard if you listen exactly to what they are asking and they give clear instructions. For tutorial make sure you show up, raise questions, and engage in the material to deepen the discussion and you'll get marked fairly

There were only 2 assignments: a midterm and final paper, 8 and 12 pages respectively. Participation in tutorials was kinda bad because you had to read some random research study and talk about it for tutorial on top of the textbook and it was worth a lot. My TA wasn't clear on the rubric and lots of people ended up really low in a grade worth 30%

Her 300W course isn't as bad as 313, because you're not expected to read hundreds of pages of some geriatric boomer's opinions. Also, the lectures are relevant and while not necessary to attend, can at least help you understand the course content better. Also, Kayleigh was helpful and accessible outside of class. Definitely a tough grader though.
This class went smoothly online and I enjoyed all of the content during this course. Lots of feedback on the drafts was helpful and made me feel more comfortable with writing.

The papers for this class are unnecessarily difficult. You are required to write 15 pages for the final paper with a whopping 21 required sources cited, 15 of which must be academic journal articles. The due date for the good copy is rendered void by the draft (completed in full) which is due 3 weeks prior. Class was basically taught by the TA.
The final exam expected 3500-4000 words for five long answer essay questions in three hours. Pretty unrealistic and needlessly stressful. Thanks. Okay lecturer but change your course formatting.

Terrible final. 3 hours to write 5 questions didnt sound too terrible until you realized she wanted 3500-4000 words ... other than that this class was great. TAs mark everything, I lucked out with Kayleigh, she was accommodating and easy to understand (unlike mass emails from Ryan) I hope they change expectations for the final in the future
Your exam and paper grades will depend on your TA at least that's how it was last sem. However, it is not a difficult class at all.

Barely went to lecture as Dr. Lysova often went on tangents and would go very fast through her slides. However she does post her slides so you can review them on your own. Make sure you follow your TA's expectations as there were different expectations. Final exam was very fair. Save yourself some money and dont buy the textbook.

Alexandra is knowledgeable in her field. Although the class was dry and about theories, she tried to engage students. Her notes were easy to read and she was always encouraged questions from students. Great prof. She is easy to get ahold of and is caring prof outside of the classrooms
Excellent lectures. Really enthusiastic about class content. I really liked it. Also very happy that she expanded the info beyond what the text said. Great professor!
Professor Lysova has a lot of energy and does a great job of keeping us focused and interested in the class. I really enjoyed this class, especially for an 8:30 am one! :)

Alexandra was very knowledgeable and passionate about the course material, which made the learning environment enjoyable. She was always helpful and clarified any questions or concerns. Overall great professor!
One of the best prof's. Hard marker but extra caring. Dont judge her yet (in the middle of the semester), wait until the end. You'll be surprised!

She's a great professor and cares about her students. Yes you have to put in the work, two large essays and four thought papers. The thought papers are easy. She made the class interesting. She offers bonus marks and she isn't there to screw us over she tells you exactly what she wants. SFU needs more professors like her!

People who don't like Hilary and her teaching style really need to grow up/actually put in effort. As a fourth year I've fully enjoyed taking this WRITING INTENSIVE class with her. She is so helpful and offers chances for bonus and will take the best of the 2 term papers as your grade. She's even making the final optional for grade improvement

Hilary is a great teacher! She is interesting to listen to and is passionate about Crim. She is a no bs person, if you don't put the effort in she wont put the effort into you. I would take her again.
STAY AWAY AT ALL TIMES. WORST TA I'VE EVER HAD. She will say your essay is wrong from top to bottom
She is super helpful and  approachable! One of the best TA!

One of my favourite profs at SFU. Lectures are actually fun. He makes the content so straightforward and easy to memorize. Exams are manageable - 4-5 essay questions and you write how much you want, and lots of freedom with the paper. There was also a tutorial group presentation, but easy A

I like logan a lot as a professor. He makes the lectures very engaging and interesting. I like the format of this class too. Studying for the tests are quite easy as he brings the material from the powerpoints which has all the info. Overall I would take his class again.

He is great! His lectures are super engaging and he goes into detail about each theory to ensure that we understand. His exams are only a few questions and you write however much you think you need to in order to get your point across. The only bad thing is it takes him about a week to post lecture slides. I definitely recommend taking his class!
Great guy, best TA ever.
Helpful, nice, and funny. One of the best TA's I've had. Has weird hair but hot.

A professor who genuinely cares for her students. Her instructions and marking criteria are clear, all you need is to FOLLOW THEM and you will likely be rewarded with a good grade. Don't fear the drafts for the papers, they are meant to prevent you from procrastination and keep you on track. Trust me, you will be very thankful for them later.
Goes off topic quite often but will rush through in the last 15 minutes. Rubric is detailed, strict prof, cry now.

Tamie is one of the best professors Ive had. She's caring, gives really informative lectures, and really wants her students to do well. The only thing that irked me were the milestone papers as they collided with assignments for my other classes and stressed me, but if time is prioritized right, its such a helpful tool that makes your work better.

One of my fav classes in my degree. I love her teaching style, and her enthusiasm that always brought me excited to her lectures. She spent so much time with me helping me edit my papers and answering all of my questions. My writing improved so much with her guidance. Tough class but follow her feedback and go to office hours, and you'll do great.
Avoid if you can.. Tough marker and super high expectations.. Yes university is not supposed to be easy, but this was the hardest class - cause of the prof out of the 15+ courses I've taken.
The class was unorganized and guidelines were not clear.

Sarah is hands down the best prof I have had at SFU. She is kind, and passionate about the topics she lectures on. The course material for 300 is dull but Sarah made the class entertaining. Highly recommend!

Not an easy a but if you work for it you will be rewarded. Fair and reasonable grading and impressive amounts of feedback. Gives students opportunities to improve their grades. Great person and lecturer. She kept class interesting and funny and is also very kind and approachable. Yerchcih makes a notoriously tough class (300) good.
Worst prof at sfu.

Not the class you want to take if you have extra curricular commitments, like a job.   Assigns work like it's the only class are taking this semester.  A little condescending. For example, a student asked a relevant question during lecture and she told him to look it up bc it was the best way to learn.  Rude.
This is a writing class so there's a lot of writing. Don't take it thinking you won't write cuz you will. A lot. Tough class but goodfair prof.

Sarah's class was what I would expect from any university class. She was sweet (when one-on-one) and helpful, but strict and demanding. Her class wasn't easy, but it didn't make me bleed. She even gave us an extension on a paper. But her 'take home midterm' was brutal (I know, it sounds like a breeze right??).
Awesome TA! Helpful and interesting. Detailed marks on papers and exams helped me to learn.  Always made time to meet with me or e-mail me with assistance. Always cheerful and friendly. Love her!

Rault kept the lectures engaging and often allowed for significant in-lecture participation. The class consisted of an annotated bib, major paper, tutorial participation, reflection assignment, and a final exam. Be sure to keep up on the readings and go to tutorial as they help a lot!! The final was a little difficult IMO so review lecture and text
